Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Mover
      • Player

  • public class Player
extends Mover
    A Player is very similar to Mover, excpet it also has information about its direction. It can return its direction, and set its direction, and calulate its speed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int myDirection 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Instantiates the default Player.
      Player(int x, int y, int b, java.awt.Color c, int dx, int dy, int d)
      Constructs a Player with initial horizontal and vertical positions specified by x and y, the width of the Player specified by b, the Color specified by c, the speed of the Player specified by dx and dy, and the direction of the Player specified by d.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int change()
      Calculates and returns the Player's speed.
      int getDirection()
      Returns the Player's direction.
      void setDirection(int a)
      Sets the direction of the Player to the input number.

    • Field Detail

      • myDirection

        private int myDirection

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Instantiates the default Player. A default Player is a Mover with myDirection defined as 1.

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
              int y,
              int b,
              java.awt.Color c,
              int dx,
              int dy,
              int d)
        Constructs a Player with initial horizontal and vertical positions specified by x and y, the width of the Player specified by b, the Color specified by c, the speed of the Player specified by dx and dy, and the direction of the Player specified by d.
        Parameters:
        x - initial horizontal position
        y - inital vertical position
        b - initial width
        c - initial Color
        dx - initial horizontal speed
        dy - initial vertical speed
        d - initial direction
